DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Intensive Care Unit Unplanned Admission Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient required an unplanned admission to the intensive care unit (ICU).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hospital Intensive Care Unit Unplanned Subject Visit Description Admission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy._An account or record of an unexpected subject visit._The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Property.preferredName: Intensive Care Unit Unplanned Subject Visit Description Admission
Property.preferredDefinition: A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.:An account or record of an unexpected subject visit.:The condition of being allowed to enter.

Concepts.definition: A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.
An account or record of an unexpected subject visit.
The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
